page.title: 01Thame General Review
page.content: Thame, mentioned in the first Domesday book, is an historic small market town (population 9 500) set midway between Aylesbury and Oxford. This farming area with its own cattle market is renowned for its wide main street designed for Tuesday open market, and has many historic buildings. To-day visitors appreciate careful conservation and fine antique shops. However, Thame continues to grow, having three post war housing estates, with new industries being attracted to the town, and the third stage of the by-pass due for completion in 1986. Thame has 3 primary schools (see p. 16) and a large secondary, Lord Williams (see p.15). In addition, there is a college of F.E. Rycote College is a fine centre for the study of furniture and rural crafts.
